intro: Cuspidocarpus thymifolius, commonly known as the thyme-leaved cuspidocarpus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and resemble those of thyme, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
